HEAD.title: Pennsylvania Spatial Data Access | Full Metadata

BODY.H2: High-Resolution Land Cover, State of New Jersey, Delaware River Basin, 2013

DL.DT: Originator:University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory
DL.DD: High-Resolution Land Cover, State of New Jersey, Delaware River Basin, 2013

DIV.PRE: High-resolution land cover dataset for the State of New Jersey, Delaware River Basin. Twelve land cover classes were mapped:0 - Background1 - Water2 - Emergent Wetlands3 - Tree Canopy4 - Scrub/Shrub5 - Low Vegetation6 - Barren7 - Structures8 - Other Impervious Surfaces9 - Roads10 - Tree Canopy over Structures11 - Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces12 - Tree Canopy over RoadsThe complete class definitions and standards can be viewed at the link below.http://goo.gl/THacggThe primary sources used to derive this land-cover layer were 2013 leaf-on orthoimagery, 2015 leaf-off orthoimagery, and leaf-off LiDAR acquired across a series of dates during the period 2006-2015. Ancillary data sources such as road centerlines and hydrology were used to augment the land-cover mapping. This land-cover dataset is considered current based on data of acquisition for the leaf-on orthoimagery. Land-cover class assignment was accomplished using a rule-based expert system embedded within an object-based framework. Object-based image analysis techniques (OBIA) work by grouping pixels into meaningful objects based on their spectral and spatial properties, while taking into account boundaries imposed by existing vector datasets. Within the OBIA environment a rule-based expert system was designed to effectively mimic the process of manual image analysis by incorporating the elements of image interpretation (color/tone, texture, pattern, location, size, and shape) into the classification process. A series of morphological procedures were employed to insure that the end product is both accurate and cartographically pleasing. Following the automated OBIA mapping a detailed manual review of the dataset was carried out at a scale of 1:3000 and all observable errors were corrected.This dataset was developed to support land-cover mapping and modeling initiatives in the Delaware River Basin. At the time of its publication, it represented the most accurate and detailed land cover map for the New Jersey portion of the Delaware River Basin.

This dataset was developed to support land-cover mapping and modeling initiatives in the Delaware River Basin. At the time of its publication, it represented the most accurate and detailed land cover map for the New Jersey portion of the Delaware River Basin.

DL.DT: Contact_Organization:University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory
Contact_Organization:University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory

DIV.PRE: This land-cover dataset was developed by the University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory. The original development of the algorithms used for this project was done in collaboration with the United States Forest Service. Funding was provided by the William Penn Foundation under a collaborative grant with Shippensburg University.

DL.DD: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.4.0.5524

DIV.PRE: No accuracy assessment was performed for this layer, but previous projects using the same workflow (automated feature extraction followed by extensive manual QA\QC) routinely achieved overall accuracies exceeding 90%.
Point-based accuracy assessments were used with previous projects using the same workflow (automated feature extraction followed by extensive manual QA\QC).
Each cell has been assigned a valid land cover code.
Complete coverage for the study area using the most recent boundary data.
Leaf-off, 4-band, 1-foot (0.3-meter) resolution orthoimagery acquired for New Jersey in 2015.
Leaf-on, 4-band, 3.281-foot (1-meter) resolution orthoimagery from the National Agricultural Imagery Program (NAIP), acquired in 2013.
Ancillary vector datasets, including road centerlines and hydrology.

Leaf-off LiDAR acquired during the period 2006-2015. This included 9 separate LiDAR collections covering different sections of the state, including: Cape May (0.5-m resolution, 2008); Coastal (0-5 m resolution, 2010); Cumberland (0.5-m resolution, 2008); DVRPC (0.5-m resolution, 2015); Highlands (1-meter resolution, 2006); Hunterdon (0.5-m resolution, 2006); Salem (0.5-m resoution, 2009); Salem Bayside (0.5-m resolution, 2008); and Warren\Sussex (0.5-meter resolution, 2008).
Object based image analysis (OBIA) using a rule-based expert system

Map_Projection_Name:Albers Conical Equal Area

DL.DD: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

DIV.PRE: Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces

Land cover class 0 - Background 1 - Water 2 - Emergent Wetlands 3 - Tree Canopy 4 - Scrub/Shrub 5 - Low Vegetation 6 - Barren 7 - Structures 8 - Other Impervious Surfaces 9 - Roads 10 - Tree Canopy over Structures 11 - Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces 12 - Tree Canopy over Roads

Twelve land cover classes were mapped: 0 - Background 1 - Water 2 - Emergent Wetlands 3 - Tree Canopy 4 - Scrub/Shrub 5 - Low Vegetation 6 - Barren 7 - Structures 8 - Other Impervious Surfaces 9 - Roads 10 - Tree Canopy over Structures 11 - Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces 12 - Tree Canopy over Roads
